By becoming a member, you will have access to a complete ecosystem: exclusive
content, jobs, etc.
summary: Rosewood Hotels & Resorts, the luxury brand under the Rosewood Hotel Group umbrella, has seen growth. The expansion is set to continue in 2024, with the anticipated openings of Rosewood Amsterdam in the Netherlands and Rosewood Schloss Fuschl in Austria.

title: Latest news: Gencom refi in Bermuda; record pipeline in Canada; Yotel deal in Tokyo
content:
Gencom refi in Bermuda. Owner-operator Gencom has refinanced the Rosewood
Bermuda with the loan originated by Blackstone Mortgage Trust and KSL Capital
Partners for an undisclosed amount. Gencom acquired the Rosewood Tucker’s Point
master-planned estate out of receivership in 2017. Following the acquisition, it
executed a $24 million renovation of the asset. Gencom’s current plan for a $17
million renovation of Tucker’s Point includes improvements to the golf course
and clubhouse, as well as the Beach Club, which features Bermuda’s longest
private beach. It will also add new amenities and food & beverage options. The
firm is also developing the Fairmont Southampton, doubling down on its
commitment to Bermuda. Recently, Gencom retook majority ownership in the 291-key
Ritz-Carlton Key Biscayne in Miami in a deal financed by Citigroup and KSL
Capital Partners. “Bermuda’s tourism and hospitality industries are expanding at
a rapid pace. We’re grateful to contribute to the country’s economic growth with
the refinancing and renovation of Rosewood Bermuda and redevelopment of Fairmont
Southampton, both of which provide significant jobs and revenue for the country.
Construction on the latter has begun, and Gencom is making progress on site
work,” Gencom Founder and Principal Karim Alibhai told Hotel Investment Today. 

Record project count in Canada. At 1Q24, there are 314 projects/39,628 rooms in
Canada’s pipeline, according to Lodging Econometrics. This new record-high in
project counts represents an 11% increase in project counts and a 5% increase in
room numbers year-over-year (YOY). Currently, there are 70 projects/9,151 rooms
under construction in Canada, up 49% and 58% YOY, respectively. Additionally, at
the close of the first quarter, there are 80 projects/9,593 rooms scheduled to
start construction in the next 12 months while projects and rooms in the early
planning stage reached all-time highs of 164 projects/20,884 rooms, increasing
13% and 1% YOY, respectively. Ontario account for 59% of the projects and 60% of
the rooms in the total pipeline, for new all-time highs of 186 projects and
23,839 rooms.

Azora develops hostel platform. As part of its strategy to develop the Latroupe
hostel platform Azora has acquired hostels in Dublin and Barcelona with 557 beds
on behalf of its Azora European Hotel and Lodging Fund (AEHL) through a
transaction with a fund managed by BlackRock. The Jacobs Inn Dublin and the
Jacobs Inn Barcelona is currently operated by Siggis Capital. The assets are
sold unencumbered and will be operated by Latroupe, the boutique hostel operator
owned by AEHL, which combines the facilities of a large hotel with the
atmosphere of a traditional hostel. Latroupe currently manages a hostel
portfolio comprising three assets in Madrid, Bilbao, and Brussels, with a
combined 700 beds. Azora’s entry into Ireland gives it a portfolio of 12,000
rooms across 41 assets.

Yotel will open in Japan in 2025

Yotel deal in Tokyo. Yotel, in partnership with Singapore-based Frasers
Hospitality, will open the first Yotel hotel in Japan in early 2025. Yotel Tokyo
Ginza will feature 244 rooms and become the brand’s flagship property. Yotel’s
wider strategy is to  expand across key cities in Japan, including Osaka, Kyoto,
Sapporo, Yokohama, Fukuoka, Nagoya, and Kobe. The group is also working on
opportunities to roll out Yotelair – the group’s unique transit hotel concept -
at key gateway airports and train stations, and part of the brand’s commitment
to new markets and goal to reach 50 hotels opened and signed by 2025.

Melco’s big deal in Sri Lanka. Melco Resorts & Entertainment Ltd. is partnering
with John Keells Holdings, the largest listed conglomerate on the Colombo Stock
Exchange, in their $1 billion plus integrated resort development in central
Colombo. The integrated resort, which had previously been branded “Cinnamon Life
Integrated Resort,” will be rebranded as “City of Dreams Sri Lanka” and become
the first integrated resort in Sri Lanka and South Asia. It will include 800
hotel rooms, retail, F&B outlets, MICE facilities, and more. Additionally, a
wholly-owned local subsidiary of Melco has been awarded a 20-year casino license
by the Government of Sri Lanka. Melco will fit-out and operate the gaming area
at City of Dreams Sri Lanka, and Melco will manage the top five floors of the
hotel under its Nuwa brand of ultra high-end luxury rooms, which represents 113
of the 800 total hotel rooms at City of Dreams Sri Lanka. Melco and John Keells
have agreed all key commercial arrangements and expect fit-out of the casino
area to begin shortly. The estimated initial investment in the casino is
expected to be approximately US$125 million. The non-gaming facilities of the
integrated resort, including the 687 key Cinnamon Life hotel managed by John
Keells, is in the final stages of completion and is expected to open in the
third quarter of 2024.

New CEO at The Lux Collective. The Lux Collective (TLC), Singapore, has
appointed Olivier Chavy as chief executive officer. Chavy will be responsible
for the overall strategic direction and performance of The Lux Collective while
pursuing its expansion. He was previously president of Travel + Leisure Group -
Panorama, the business line managing the company’s exchange and membership
travel brands. Paul Jones will be departing TLC in June 2024 following a 14-year
tenure as CEO.

Greensboro hotel trades. A group of Charlotte, North Carolina, investors has
reportedly purchased a Greensboro hotel near the Piedmont Triad International
Airport for $5 million. iCare Hospitality Greensboro bought the 60-room Clarion
Pointe Greensboro Airport hotel, according to filings with the Guilford County
Register of Deeds. The seller was PRBGP Hospitality, which it originally
acquired the property for $3.58 million in 2016.

Cheval Collection to Riyadh. KSA’s Ladun Investment Co. has signed a partnership
agreement with Cheval Collection for the construction and operation of Ladun
Cheval Living – a tower featuring luxury hotel apartments situated near King
Abdullah Financial Center in Riyadh. The partnership marks the first project of
Cheval Collection in Saudi Arabia, and will feature 130 residential units of
various sizes, from one to three rooms, along with amenities including a gym,
swimming pool, and sauna. Construction of the tower with a total cost of up
£63.8m is set to commence this year with expected completion in 2027.

Trilogy grows in Australia. Newly launched Trilogy Hotels and Panthers Group
have signed an agreement that will see Trilogy Hotels oversee operations of the
153-room Pullman Sydney Penrith in Australia. Panthers Group invested $110
million on the project that opened last August. Trilogy now operates nearly
1,200 rooms across five hotels.

IHG’s Indigo brand to Bangkok. IHG Hotels & Resorts has signed a deal with
developer Magnolia Quality Development Corp. for a 274-room Hotel Indigo The
Forestias Bangkok, which will open in 2026 at The Forestias, a new integrated
mixed-used development on the eastern fringe of Bangkok. The hotel will be
located alongside residential and office space, retail, dining and family
entertainment options, expansive meeting spaces and a hospital. The Forestias
will also be home to another IHG property, Six Senses The Forestias, a 85-room
hotel and 27 residences development closely attached to a five-hectare forest
park.

IHCL grows Ginger brand. Indian Hotels Co. Ltd. (IHCL) has signed an agreement
with Banaras Beads Exports Pvt. Ltd. to develop a Ginger hotel in Varanasi,
Uttar Pradesh, India. The hotel is a Greenfield project on a fully fitted
operating lease. The 101-key hotel will feature Qmin, the signature all-day
diner, and amenities that include a fitness center and meeting rooms. With this
addition, IHCL will have 23 hotels in Uttar Pradesh under Taj,
SeleQtions,Vivanta and Ginger brands, including 10 under development.

JW coming to Jeddah. Marriott International and Al Qimmah Hospitality (a
subsidiary of BinDawood Trading) signed an agreement to introduce the JW
Marriott brand in Jeddah. Situated on the Jeddah Corniche, JW Marriott Hotel
Jeddah is anticipated to offer 280 guestrooms including more than 50 suites.
Plans for the hotel include two restaurants, a lobby cafe and pool lounge, and
leisure facilities including a swimming pool, fitness center, and Spa by JW.
summary: Gencom has refinanced Rosewood Bermuda and is developing Fairmont Southampton. Azora has acquired hostels in Dublin and Barcelona with 557 beds. Melco Resorts & Entertainment has signed a big deal in Sri Lanka. Yotel will open its first hotel in Japan in early 2025.

title: The Best Rosewood Hotels in the World
content:
Rosewood Hotels and Resorts are renowned for creating unique, immersive
experiences that pair the culture and spirit of the destination with the highest
standards of luxury and personalized service. Pursuitist showcases the top five
Rosewood properties that are absolute must-visits for any discerning traveler.
Our selection criteria include the captivating design of each property, the
allure of the destination, culinary excellence, exceptional VIP services, and
the unique, unforgettable experiences at each property.

About Rosewood

Rosewood Hotels & Resorts is a prestigious international hospitality company
that was launched in 1979 by Caroline Rose Hunt, a daughter of the Texas oil
tycoon H.L. Hunt. The first property of this company was The Mansion on Turtle
Creek in Dallas, Texas, which opened its doors in 1981 and quickly gained a
reputation as one of the finest hotels in the United States. Over the years, the
brand expanded, establishing properties in a number of countries worldwide. It
gained renown for its distinctive collection of luxurious, residential-style
hotels inspired by the culture, history, and geography of each location.

Today, Rosewood Hotels & Resorts boasts over 20 iconic properties in 15
countries, with a mission to “create a sense of place” for guests. Each hotel
and resort is designed to blend the distinctive culture and aesthetics of its
location with modern luxury, providing guests with unparalleled service,
superior attention to detail, and a truly unique hospitality experience.
Rosewood’s properties are known for their timeless elegance, innovative dining
experiences, and commitment to social responsibility. With a distinct philosophy
of relationship hospitality, Rosewood continues to grow its portfolio with
projects that showcase a careful balance between the environment, culture, and
the unique narratives of each property’s locale.

Pursuitist’s Curated Top 5 Rosewood Hotels & Resorts

For the discerning luxury traveler seeking relaxation, adventure, and culinary
excellence, Pursuitist presents our curated selection of the top five Rosewood
Hotels and Resorts. These must-visit destinations offer the epitome of luxury
experiences, defining your travel bucket list with unique adventures,
unparalleled comfort, and gastronomic delights. Your unique journey towards an
unforgettable luxury escape begins here.

Hôtel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel, Paris, France

The Hôtel de Crillon, nestled in the heart of Paris, exudes grandeur that
transcends time. This 18th-century palace was painstakingly restored, marrying
its rich architectural heritage with contemporary amenities and cutting-edge
technology. Given its location, just steps away from iconic landmarks like the
Louvre and the Champs-Élysées, it offers an unrivaled destination for cultural
immersion.

The hotel’s Michelin-starred restaurant, L’Ecrin, is an art piece in itself,
offering a culinary journey that mirrors the city’s sophistication and
innovation. VIP services here are unmatched, with offerings such as private art
and history tours, personal shopping services, and bespoke experiences that take
luxury to new heights.

Pursuitist Tip:

 * Arrange for the private art tour, which takes you through the hidden gems of
   the Louvre, guided by a local art historian.
 * Don’t miss the tailored shopping experience, where the concierge can help
   arrange private visits to couture houses.
 * Spend an afternoon at the Sense Spa for rejuvenating treatments followed by a
   refreshing dip in the rooftop swimming pool.

Hôtel de Crillon, A Rosewood Hotel, Paris, France

Las Ventanas al Paraíso, A Rosewood Resort, San José del Cabo, Mexico

‘Las Ventanas al Paraíso,’ aptly translates to ‘The Windows to Paradise.’ This
Rosewood Resort offers an all-suite luxury escape that blends contemporary
design with traditional Mexican decor, offering a serene and intimate setting.
With its paradisiacal views over the Sea of Cortez and proximity to San José del
Cabo’s vibrant local culture and breathtaking natural landscapes, it offers an
experience like no other.

The resort’s dining experience stands out, with offerings such as a dinner under
the star-studded desert sky. VIP services are woven into every aspect of your
stay, including personalized butler services, private tequila tastings, and
oceanfront spa treatments.

Pursuitist Tip:

 * Engage in the traditional Mexican craft workshop to delve deeper into the
   local culture.
 * Don’t miss out on the private Tequila tasting session, where a seasoned
   sommelier guides you through the rich history and nuances of this beloved
   spirit.
 * Try out the resort’s bespoke wellness programs, designed to invigorate your
   mind, body, and spirit.

Las Ventanas al Paraíso, A Rosewood Resort, San José del Cabo, Mexico

Rosewood Sanya, Hainan, China

Embracing the lush tropical allure of Haitang Bay, Rosewood Sanya offers an
oasis of luxury. The resort’s design is a nod to local culture, beautifully
entwined with contemporary elegance. Each room and suite provide breathtaking
ocean views, making it an idyllic retreat to explore Hainan’s tropical charm.

The dining options offer an exquisite mix of Chinese and international cuisine,
showcasing the island’s rich gastronomic landscape. The VIP services extend to
curated excursions to cultural sites, personalized wellness retreats, and
exclusive access to private events.

Pursuitist Tip:

 * Explore the island’s fascinating underwater world with a guided scuba diving
   session.
 * Try the Hainanese chicken rice at the resort’s restaurant – a local dish
   prepared to perfection.
 * Book a traditional Chinese tea ceremony to immerse yourself in the rich
   culture.

Rosewood Sanya, Hainan, China

Rosewood Castiglion del Bosco, Tuscany, Italy

Situated in one of Tuscany’s oldest and best-preserved estates, Rosewood
Castiglion del Bosco encapsulates the soul of Tuscany. With a picturesque
backdrop of stunning landscapes, vineyards, and historical sites, it is a portal
to the very heart of Italian culture and history.

Dining here is a celebration of traditional Tuscan cuisine. The estate’s very
own Brunello di Montalcino wine is the perfect accompaniment. VIP services
extend to private vineyard tours, custom-made Italian itineraries, private
cooking classes, and a host of personalized experiences.

Pursuitist Tip:

 * Indulge in a truffle hunting adventure, followed by a truffle-infused meal, a
   truly Tuscan experience.
 * Try your hand at an authentic Italian cooking class, where local chefs
   introduce you to the region’s most beloved dishes.
 * Visit the property’s private chapel, home to splendid frescoes from the 14th
   century.

Rosewood Castiglion del Bosco

Rosewood Little Dix Bay, British Virgin Islands

An eco-friendly paradise, Rosewood Little Dix Bay is nestled within a 500-acre
nature reserve. The hotel offers stunning views of the private bay, pristine
beaches, and vibrant coral reefs. The locally-sourced Caribbean fare at the
hotel’s dining facilities is a gastronomic delight, while VIP services like
private yacht charters and individualized wellness retreats elevate the
experience.

Pursuitist Tip:

 * Venture into the depths of the sea with a guided snorkeling tour and discover
   a vibrant underwater world.
 * Don’t miss a chance to sail in the azure Caribbean waters with the hotel’s
   private yacht charter.
 * Spend a day hiking in the nature reserve to observe the local flora and
   fauna.

Rosewood Little Dix Bay, British Virgin Islands

With its remarkable history and commitment to luxurious, personalized service,
Rosewood Hotels & Resorts continues to redefine the standard of luxury
hospitality. Whether you’re exploring the rich culture of Paris, reveling in the
tropical allure of Hainan, enjoying the culinary treasures of Tuscany, or

title: Exclusive: Rosewood Is Launching a Collection of Branded Residences in Los Cabos
content:
Rosewood has unveiled its first standalone branded residential community in
Mexico, and Robb Report got an exclusive first look. The luxury hospitality
brand has announced the launch of the Rosewood Residences Old Lighthouse, a
sprawling 550-acre development in Los Cabos. The private estate is set near the
southernmost tip of the Baja Peninsula and is being developed in partnership
with the Coppel family—founders of Pueblo Bonito, a leading hotel and resort
company in Mexico. Once complete, the heart of the project will be El Faro
Viejo, the landmark from which the property gets its name and the oldest
standing structure in Cabo San Lucas.

Building on Rosewood’s growing branded real estate portfolio, the private
bluff-top community will be designed by Mexico City-based architect Manuel
Cervantes Céspedes and merge modern perks with the site’s storied past.
Altogether, the property will comprise 144 residences and a bevy of swanky
amenities, including an on-site beach club, an athletic center, a clubhouse, and
a wellness facility. Residents will also enjoy unrestricted access to a
world-class, Jack Nicklaus-designed golf course. 

RELATED: First Look Inside Rosewood Residences Beverly Hills  



A rendering of the forthcoming Rosewood Residences Old Lighthouse in Los Cabos,
Mexico. Noe & Associates

“We are thrilled to partner with Rosewood on this one-of-a-kind project, which
is to set a new benchmark in luxurious and adventure-bound living,” said Jose
Luis Mogollon, managing partner at Old Lighthouse. “Crafting memorable and
personalized experiences at every touchpoint, Rosewood brings a distinct
exclusivity and level of service to this project that will set Rosewood
Residences Old Lighthouse apart from other residential offerings in Los Cabos.”

The Rosewood team has curated a world-class lifestyle paired with cutting-edge
design that brings an elevated sense of luxury to residents and guests in a
secured environment that is in tune with the natural surroundings and the local
culture.



The 550-acre development overlooks the rugged Pacific Ocean coastline. Noe &
Associates

RELATED: Aman’s First Standalone Branded Residences Will Be in Tokyo

The 144 residences, designed by Guadalajara-based architects Gomez Vazquez
International and interior designers Studio Lifestyle, will range from an ample
4,000 square feet to more than 10,000 square feet. Each residence will blend
indoor and outdoor living and showcase materials and finishes that reflect the
natural environment. Looking ahead, buyers will be able to purchase premium lots
where they can design and build a custom home. Sales at Rosewood Residences Old
Lighthouse are slated to commence in late 2024.

The extensive range of amenities the enclave offers also includes a five-star
restaurant with a private dining room, and owners will benefit from hotel-like
programming as well. Think of experiences like horseback riding, offshore
fishing, and snorkeling in the Sea of Cortez. 



The 144 private villas will offer a relaxed indoor-outdoor lifestyle. Noe &
Associates

“Our partnership with Ernesto Coppel and the Coppel family will revitalize one
of Los Cabos’ most iconic addresses and provide discerning buyers with an
unmatched living experience in a remarkable setting,” added Brad Berry, vice
president of global residential development at Rosewood Hotel Group. “Los Cabos
is a special place where luxury seamlessly intertwines with nature, adventure,
and leisure, and we look forward to facilitating exceptional immersions and
moments of discovery for our owners and their guests.”

title: Six Rosewood Hotels Aim to Blend Luxury Travel With Positive Social Impact
content:
SKIFT TAKE

Can you combine indulgence with making a meaningful difference? Rosewood
believes it will at a half-dozen of its ultra-luxury hotels.

Sean O'Neill

Rosewood Hotel Group, the ultra-luxury brand, has quietly launched a program
that sets a higher bar for meeting environmental, social, and governance (ESG)
goals.

The initiative, called Impact Trailblazers, spotlights hotels that pledge to
achieve at least one of six stretch goals by 2025. Goals include reducing waste
like single-use plastics, sourcing supplies locally, and developing community
partnerships to hire locally.

“These properties are not just meeting our ambitious sustainability goals —
they’re exceeding them, showcasing that luxury and positive impact can be
synonymous,” said Mehvesh Mumtaz Ahmed, vice president of social impact at
Rosewood Hotel Group, in an exclusive interview.

Rosewood hopes its half-dozen top performers inspire all of its hotels and the
broader industry. It operates 44 hotels and has over 30 in development.

The program claims to have some early results. Rosewood São Paulo has achieved
90% waste diversion, operates on 100% renewable energy, and has hired 45% of its
workforce from underserved groups. Rosewood Phuket sources all ingredients for
its signature restaurant locally. Rosewood Mayakoba in Mexico supports a
non-profit school, while Rosewood Phnom Penh partners with a vocational training
non-profit in Cambodia.

Rosewood Mayakoba. Source: Rosewood.


ROSEWOOD’S IMPACT

Here are some of the early successes claimed by these hotels.

 * Rosewood São Paulo has achieved 90% waste diversion and operates on 100%
   renewable energy. It has hired 45% of its workforce from underserved local
   groups.

 * Rosewood Phuket has been one of the local pioneers in environmental
   sustainability, earning LEED Gold Certification and achieving local sourcing
   goals. Its signature restaurant, Ta Khai, sources all ingredients locally,
   supporting community farmers using sustainable practices.

 * Rosewood Mayakoba revived a non-profit school in Riviera Maya that had
   stopped functioning and now supports over 450 students. It recently added a
   separate building for a new secondary school.

 * Rosewood Phnom Penh partners with a local non-profit offering vocational
   training to Cambodian youth, bringing in students for performances and
   demonstrations of local artistic traditions.

 * Rosewood Baha Mar focuses on coral conservation in The Bahamas, partnering
   with the Bahamas Reef Environment Educational Foundation. The resort employs
   95% local staff and promotes diversity and female representation at
   supervisory levels.

 * Rosewood Hong Kong introduced BluHouse, a restaurant concept that employs
   refugees and ethnic minorities.


HOTEL BUSINESS BENEFITS

Ahmed challenged the notion that doing good compromises business performance.

“The travel sector accepts that there’s a trade-off between doing well and doing
good far too easily,” Ahmed said. “The fact that two of our Impact Trailblazers
properties — Rosewood Hong Kong and Rosewood São Paulo — were recently featured
in the latest 50 Best Hotels list shows that there’s definitely not a trade-off
in delivering luxury and having a positive social impact.”

The efforts can also translate into enhancing guest loyalty.

“Luxury is a feeling,” Ahmed said. “It’s about the connection we create with our
guests, and this can be fostered even without spelling out the social impact
piece.”

“If you’ve stayed at Rosewood Mayakoba, you’ll know that each guest receives a
beautiful little, colorful, folklore animal representative of Mayan culture,”
Ahmed said. “Guests have commented positively on these figurines. But what most
don’t know is that these figures are special because they are carved through a
partnership with a social enterprise that hires women recovery from domestic
abuse.”

Rosewood executives also believe that hotels with a social impact work have a
better chance of attracting and retaining top talent.

“The pandemic has accelerated this trend of people wanting to know that the work
that they are doing most of the hours of their day is doing something positive
for the world,” Ahmed said.

title: Sonia Cheng, scion of Hong Kong’s New World billionaire family, is steering the Rosewood hotel brand to new heights
content:
When the inaugural World’s 50 Best Hotels ranking was revealed in September
2023, three Rosewood properties, each located in a different continent, featured
on the list. Taking the number two spot and earning the distinction of “The Best
Hotel in Asia” was Rosewood Hong Kong. Rosewood Sao Paulo ranked at number 27,
while Hotel de Crillon in Paris rounded up the list at number 50.

The achievement is “a huge recognition to the team and all the effort they have
put into the brand,” reflected Sonia Cheng, CEO of Rosewood Hotel Group. “For
three of our properties to be recognised, and for Rosewood Hong Kong to be
number two in the world, that is a significant recognition.”

Cheng, 43, hails from one of Hong Kong’s billionaire family dynasties. Her
grandfather, the late Cheng Yu-tung, founded real estate and investment
conglomerate, New World Development. The elder Cheng’s rags-to-riches story
began when he turned a Macau gold shop into the now renowned Chow Tai Fook
Jewellery chain. His son, and Cheng’s father, Henry Cheng, is now chairman of
the businesses.

After pursuing a career in banking and finance, Cheng, who graduated from
Harvard with a major in applied mathematics, joined the family fold at the age
of 28 to head up its hospitality business. In 2011, New World Hospitality
acquired Rosewood Hotels & Resorts, then based in Texas, US, for a reported
US$229.5 million. Back then, while the Rosewood name was familiar among North
American travellers, it was not well-known on an international scale.

Under Cheng’s leadership, Rosewood has since evolved into a global player in the
luxury hospitality space, with openings in key cities including Beijing, London,
Abu Dhabi, Munich and more. Its portfolio of 33 one-of-a-kind luxury hotels in
21 countries also includes legendary properties such as The Carlyle in New York,
and the Hotel de Crillon in Paris, both of which have undergone a transformation
under Rosewood.

There are currently another 27 hotels in the pipeline, with Cheng describing the
next two years as Rosewood’s “peak opening years”, where it will continue to
expand in Europe, Japan, the Middle East, China, Mexico, New Zealand and more.
“The next couple of years is really exciting. Key gateway cities have always
been our target, but we also explore new destinations and projects that we think
fit the Rosewood philosophy. These projects may not be in gateway locations that
travellers expect, but I think what travellers are looking for in this day and
age is for Rosewood to take them on a journey to explore new destinations.”

title: Rosewood Hotel Group Accelerates Growth And Evolution Across Its Four Distinctive Brands
content:
Rosewood Hotel Group, one of the world’s leading global lifestyle and
hospitality management groups, continues to expand its global footprint and
evolve its four brands – Rosewood Hotels & Resorts®, New World® Hotels &
Resorts, Asaya, and Carlyle & Co.; and residential business, Rosewood
Residences. Over the last five years, the Group has experienced ambitious yet
thoughtful growth, with its ultra-luxury Rosewood Hotels & Resorts brand signing
an impressive number of new deals compared to its competitive set. Following a
monumental 2023 which introduced the Group into new global territories,
including New Zealand and Hawaii; and lifestyle categories, including
experiential retail; 2024 promises to deliver even more new deal signings,
property openings and enriching experiences in the world’s most inspiring
destinations.


A GROWING, GLOBAL PRESENCE

Rosewood Hotel Group’s combined portfolio now consists of 48 hotels, resorts,
and residences across 23 countries, each embracing the brand's A Sense of Place®
philosophy to reflect the individual location's history, culture, and
sensibilities. For Rosewood Hotels & Resorts, 2023 saw three properties open:
Rosewood Munich, Kona Village, A Rosewood Resort, and the brand’s New Zealand
lodge collection consisting of Rosewood Cape Kidnappers, Rosewood Kauri Cliffs
and Rosewood Matakauri. These launches represented the Group’s first flags in
Germany, Hawai’i, and New Zealand, respectively, and brought Rosewood Hotels &
Resorts’ total hotel count to 33 properties across 21 countries. For New World
Hotels & Resorts, the past year featured the launches of three new properties,
which was a record for this growing brand and brought the total portfolio count
to 15 properties. This development further expanded New World’s footprint in
Vietnam and China, raising the brand’s flag in Hoi An, Taishan and Guangzhou.

Equally as impressive as the Group’s operational portfolio is its curated
pipeline of projects, each of which has been thoughtfully considered to inspire
adventure and discovery. Today, Rosewood Hotel Group has 35 properties under
development, reflecting one of the industry’s strongest pipelines when
considered as a percentage of a brand’s complete portfolio. While the Group’s
pipeline has been consistently impressive, it is the past five years which have
made a profound impact on the trajectory of the company globally and its status
as a leader in the industry.

Six new deal signings for Rosewood Hotels & Resorts in 2023 contributed to this
positioning. These include Rosewood Hotels & Resorts’ first-ever properties in
Barbuda, Greece, South Korea and the Maldives, together underscoring the brand’s
commitment to bringing its unique approach to hospitality to both cultural
capitals and exotic island destinations. Rosewood Amaala was also announced in
2023, which will mark the brand’s fourth property in Saudi Arabia upon opening.
The deal to manage the iconic Robertson Lodges in New Zealand was also penned in
2023.


AREAS OF EXPANSION

These additions reiterate Rosewood’s strategic areas for expansion. Having just
grown its presence in Europe by 100% in less than three years, the region
continues to be a key focus for the Group. 2024 will see the opening of Rosewood
Amsterdam in the Netherlands and Rosewood Schloss Fuschl in Austria, followed in
2025 by new properties in Greece, Venice, Milan, Rome, and a second London
hotel, The Chancery Rosewood.

The Middle East’s propensity for luxury hospitality has been similarly central
to the Group’s strategic future expansion, with several new properties set to
join its Middle Eastern portfolio. Building upon its current presence in Abu
Dhabi and Jeddah, Rosewood Doha will open its doors in Qatar this year. In the
Middle East, future growth is focused on Saudi Arabia, whose ongoing
transformation for a new era of travel aligns naturally with Rosewood’s
trailblazing reputation for impeccable, first-class service. Three new hotels
are set to debut in Saudi Arabia in the coming years: Rosewood Diriyah in 2025,
alongside the future openings Rosewood Red Sea and Rosewood Amaala.

The pipeline for Rosewood Hotel Group also continues to grow in Asia Pacific,
and in 2024 will see the opening of Rosewood Miyakojima, marking Rosewood’s
entry into Japan. New World Chongqing Hotel in China will also debut in the
foreseeable future. Looking further ahead, future openings in China include
Rosewood Shenzhen, Rosewood Hangzhou, Rosewood Shanghai, Rosewood Chongqing,
Rosewood Ningbo, and Rosewood Xi’An. In the greater Asia Pacific region,
anticipated destinations include Rosewood Hoi An, Rosewood Seoul and Rosewood
Ranfaru in the Maldives.

In the Americas, development stretches across The United States, Mexico, and The
Caribbean. 2025 will add Rosewood Mexico City and Rosewood Mandarina to the
growing portfolio of properties in Mexico. Looking ahead, another icon will be
reborn under the Rosewood flag with Rosewood The Raleigh in Miami Beach, which
will include 44 Rosewood Residences in a newly built Peter Marino-designed
building. Also consisting of both a resort and residential experience will be
Rosewood Barbuda, opening on the exquisite Caribbean island in 2028.


ENRICHED LIVING, EVERY DAY

Rosewood Hotels & Resorts' branded residential business, Rosewood Residences, is
a refined collection of estate homes, luxury villas and serviced apartments
carefully curated to enrich the lives of all who call them home. Currently
consisting of 14 properties across ten countries, this collection allows owners
and guests to unlock an elevated lifestyle supported by the very best in design,
amenities, and service.

For the last several years, Rosewood Residences has been experiencing
exceptional growth, with the number of projects in development currently sitting
at an all-time high. The industry has taken notice: in the 2023 Brand Residences
Report produced by Savills [1], one of the world’s pioneering real estate
advisors and consultancies, Rosewood Residences ranked 4th in its competitive
set of independent luxury brands in regard to the number of completed and
pipeline projects.

A highlight of this pipeline is six standalone residential properties, the first
of which was only announced in 2021. The rapid growth of Rosewood Residences’
standalone properties is a further proof point of guests’ growing desire to
access the Rosewood lifestyle beyond the hotel and resort experiences. In 2023,
two such destinations were identified and announced: Rosewood Residences
Hillsboro Beach in Florida and Rosewood Residences Turtle Creek in Dallas,
Texas. These newly announced projects join the additional standalone pipeline
properties of Rosewood Residences Naples and Rosewood Residences Lido Key, both
in Florida; Rosewood Residences Kamala in Phuket, and Rosewood Residences
Beverly Hills in California. The Beverly Hills property will open later this
year to officially debut the exclusively residential Rosewood experience.

Alongside these standalone properties in the pipeline are four Rosewood
Residences that will be co-located within a hotel or resort property, including
Rosewood Residences Mandarina, Rosewood Residences Miami Beach, Rosewood
Residences Doha, and Rosewood Residences Barbuda.

Across both the standalone and mixed-use properties in operation as well as in
development, the team is continuously raising the bar to deliver an elevated
lifestyle experience that speaks to the unique needs of today’s buyer. New and
innovative offerings introduced or announced by Rosewood Residences in the last
year include elevated food and beverage services, such as expert wine curation,
private restaurants and bars, and curated in-home dining; dedicated shared and
private spaces for visiting guests, younger residents, and pets; indoor and
outdoor amenities and social areas designed specifically for entertaining; and,
of course, a range of state-of-the-art wellness experiences. As wellness is a
top priority for many people today, Rosewood Residences has taken great care to
introduce new opportunities for residents and guests to stay well, from paddle
tennis and pickleball courts, private salons and spas, to rooftop yoga pitches
and pools.

In the end, Rosewood Residences’ impressive growth of its physical footprint and
innovative offerings contributed to a 135% increase in sales year over year in
2023, with total sales amounting to $434 million. This demand underscores that
Rosewood Residences are providing buyers with the type of modern-day living that
they are looking for and a community of which they wish to be an active
participant.


ASAYA: INTEGRATED APPROACH TO WELLNESS

Asaya, Rosewood’s integrated, holistic health and wellness concept designed to
unlock long-lasting and transformative well-being, will flourish in 2024 with
new launches and unique experiences. Since its inception at Rosewood Phuket in
2017, Asaya has launched in five additional locations. Today, there is Asaya
Active at Rosewood Guangzhou, Asaya Retreat at Rosewood Hong Kong, and Asaya Spa
at Rosewood Vienna, Rosewood Munich, and Kona Village, A Rosewood Resort. The
openings in Munich and Hawai’i in 2023 constitute growth of the Asaya concept by
50%. This past year also saw 10% growth of Asaya’s membership model, which is
available in certain urban destinations including Hong Kong, Guangzhou, and now
Munich.

Understanding how holistic well-being is foundational to a fulfilling life, the
evolution of Asaya is of paramount importance to Rosewood Hotel Group in 2024
and beyond. Today, there are 19 Asayas in the pipeline at both future and
existing Rosewood properties. In the coming year, seven will debut, reflecting
the brand’s largest single-year expansion to date. All four of Rosewood Hotels &
Resorts’ new 2024 openings – Rosewood Doha, Rosewood Miyakojima, Rosewood
Schloss Fuschl, and Rosewood Amsterdam – will feature Asaya. This will mark the
brand’s entry to The Middle East and Japan and double its count in Europe. In
addition, existing properties Rosewood São Paulo, Rosewood Mayakoba and Rosewood
Sand Hill will also introduce the Asaya experience. In keeping with the Rosewood
brand’s guiding philosophy, each Asaya will offer immersive programming inspired
by the destination in which it sits, with practices informed by local culture
and heritage. Each new Asaya will further deliver exclusive treatments and
products from some of the most innovative wellness brands in the world,
including Dr. Barbara Sturm within Rosewood Doha and Rosewood Schloss Fuschl and
Guerlain at Rosewood São Paulo. These partnerships reflect the brand’s
commitment to providing preeminent wellness experiences that are both
established and innovative.


RAREFIED RETAIL

Marking the brand’s growing presence as a luxury lifestyle brand, Rosewood
Hotels & Resorts continued its expansion into the retail space in 2023 with the
launch of new e-commerce storefronts for nine of its hotels – including Rosewood
Sand Hill, Rosewood Miramar Beach, and Kona Village, A Rosewood Resort. This was
the most storefronts to launch in a single year since Rosewood first entered
into the e-commerce space in 2019, and brought the total number of platforms to
13. These channels invite Rosewood aficionados to bring home an element of the
hotel experience and purchase incredible experiences.

In 2023, Rosewood further strengthened its retail proposition through an
exclusive partnership with The Webster, a luxury multi-brand retailer offering
fashion, accessories, beauty and homeware. The partnership commenced with a
summer pop-up series across Rosewood Miramar Beach in California and Rosewood
Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas, which invited Rosewood guests to shop
exclusive collections inspired by these distinctive destinations. In celebration
of the 2023 festive season, the partnership further included a bespoke retail
edit to shop online. The edit consisted of The Webster’s founder, Laure Heriard
Dubréuil’s personal picks for the holidays. This model will be expanded upon in
2024, with Rosewood looking to launch unique product collaborations with leading
brands across the categories of fashion, wellness, home design, and more.

title: Rosewood Hotel Georgia in Vancouver Reopens After Makeover
content:
Rosewood Hotel Georgia in Vancouver has reopened following a five-month
renovation to unveil refreshed culinary concepts and accommodations, alongside a
new F&B option, The Georgia Bar. First opened in 1927 as Hotel Georgia, the
property was last renovated in 2011 when it was introduced as Rosewood Hotel
Georgia.

The hotel tapped New York-based Lillian Wu Studio for the redesign of its 156
rooms and suites, while Vancouver-based design firm Ste. Marie Studio redesigned
the hotel’s public spaces, including the lobby and culinary concepts. The newly
refreshed bi-level 1927 Lounge continues to offer fine dining and artisanal
cocktails; open for guests and locals alike, the 1927 Lounge hosts live
performances from R&B, jazz and soul artists on select nights. The space also
houses a piano, which serves as an accompaniment for performances that can be
enjoyed from both 1927 as well as The Georgia Bar, the hotel’s new
mixology-focused concept. Its signature cocktail menu includes odes to the
property’s heritage, complemented by a range of light bites.



Deluxe King Preferred View Room (Photo by Rosewood Hotel Georgia)

Following the property’s initial reopening, Reflections Terrace will be
relaunched in the second half of 2024 as a year-round dining destination. Upon
its debut, Reflections will sport a biophilic design and a new, fully
retractable roof.

Located in a space beneath the hotel, the newly opened Prophecy is a new F&B
concept that has a cocktail menu inspired by writers, poets, musicians and
artists. Shareable plates are tailored to various tastes, and range from
familiar favorites to seafood selections.

Rosewood Hotel Georgia has also introduced its bookable “Master Class” series
led by the property’s food and beverage team. Guests will visit Vancouver’s
Granville Market to select locally sourced, hyperseasonal ingredients that they
will then craft into both a signature dish and paired cocktail. Constantly
shifting based on which Pacific Northwest delicacies are in prime harvest, the
series offers an immersive experience as well as a lesson in sustainable and
hyperlocal cuisine.
